byline.original: By CHARLES V. BAGLI and MIREYA NAVARRO

lead_paragraph: Housing programs and tax incentives would be overhauled to promote the construction of tens of thousands of units for poor New Yorkers, who are being priced out of the booming real estate market.

headline.print_headline: Mayor’s Plan Aims to Spur More Housing
headline.main: Mayor de Blasio’s Plan Aims to Spur More Affordable Housing in New York

snippet: Housing programs and tax incentives would be overhauled to promote the construction of tens of thousands of units for poor New Yorkers, who are being priced out of the booming real estate market.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio calls for ambitious overhaul of city's housing programs and tax incentives, aiming to build thousands of apartments for poor New Yorkers and public workers who are being priced out of city; plan would require developers throughout city to set aside 25 to 30 percent of new projects for poor and working-class residents in return for tax breaks.
